Occiban is a high-end disinfectant coating that uses nano-technology to continuously protect any surface from virusses, bacteria and other known pathogens.



Occiban is a high-end disinfectant coating that uses nano-technology to continuously protect any surface from virusses, bacteria and other known pathogens.

About Occiban

Occiban is a disinfectant that both actively kills and protects from new pathogens.

In contrast to other disinfectant, Occiban is completely organic which means it is safe for your skin because it doesn’t contain any harmful chemicals. It doesn’t contain any alcohol so the skin or other surfaces won’t dry out.

It has been trusted by hospitals and used operating rooms for over 15 years. FDA approved, and EPA safe which means you could drink it. But we don’t recommend it, since it lacks taste and odour.

LEARN MORE ABOUT THE TECHNOLOGY

What Others Are Saying

A modern dental practice in Melle decided on Occiban to protect its facility, employees and patients.

“To be honest, I knew my cleaning crew had to work longer hours simply due to the meticulous job that is disinfecting every high touch surface.

After a few weeks it became clear that I couldn’t leave such an important job up to people who had no time for it.”

- Evelyne, General Manager of Lightfalls Clinic

Our Products & Services

Occi 8hr Hand Sanitizer

- Alcohol Free
- Fragrance Free
- Non Flammable
- Does not dry out skin
- Doesn’t stick

Occi All Purpose

- Unlike ‘chemical kill’ used by common disinfectants, silica based technology uses ‘mechanical kill’
- 30 days protection*

Spraying Service

- Monthly service
- 1 time complete service
- Only high touch traffic areas
- Sprayed with electrostatic sprayer for optimal coverage

REQUEST A QUOTE

Occiban’s Nano Technology

The antimicrobial effect occurs when the solution dries and mechanically attaches, leaving behind a 4nm silica dioxide crystalline-like barrier.


This barrier will actively kill and protect against most known germs including the Covid-19 virus.


The coating only wears off due to heavy abrasion.
